title: Continuous Autonomous Task Loop Pattern

problem.en: Traditional development workflows require constant human intervention: manual task selection, context switching, rate limit handling, and repetitive git operations.
problem.ko: 전통적인 개발 워크플로우는 지속적인 인간 개입이 필요합니다: 수동 작업 선택, 컨텍스트 전환, 속도 제한 처리, 반복적인 git 작업.

solution.en: Implement a continuous loop with fresh context per iteration, autonomous task selection via subagents, automated git management, and intelligent rate limit handling.
solution.ko: 반복당 새로운 컨텍스트, 서브에이전트를 통한 자율 작업 선택, 자동화된 git 관리, 지능적인 속도 제한 처리를 갖춘 연속 루프를 구현합니다.

mermaid_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant Script as Autonomous Script
    participant TaskAgent as Task Master
    participant MainAgent as Main Agent
    participant GitAgent as Git Master

    loop Continuous Processing
        Script->>TaskAgent: Select next task
        TaskAgent-->>Script: Task selected
        Script->>MainAgent: Execute task
        MainAgent-->>Script: Task completed
        Script->>GitAgent: Commit changes
        GitAgent-->>Script: Committed
    end
code_example:
#!/bin/bash
MAX_ITERATIONS=50
RATE_LIMIT_BACKOFF=300

for ((i=1; i<=MAX_ITERATIONS; i++)); do
    # Select next task via subagent
    TASK=$(claude --print "Read TODO.md, return next task")
    
    # Execute with fresh context
    claude --dangerously-skip-permissions "$TASK"
    
    # Commit via git subagent
    claude --print "Commit changes with descriptive message"
    
    # Handle rate limits
    if [[ $? -eq 429 ]]; then
        sleep $RATE_LIMIT_BACKOFF
    fi
done
